content.text:
Based on the documents, here's the current plan and status:

## Project Overview
**SheSocial** - A luxury social platform for Taiwan's high-end market focused on finding romantic partners with the theme "1+1=âˆ (Finding a partner: one you, one me, drawing a circle)".

## Current Status
The project appears to be in **Phase 1** with most core features marked as completed ([x]) in the implementation plan:

### âœ… Completed (Phase 1-2)
- User system with registration/login (email + LINE Login)
- Payment integration (LINE Pay + ECPay sandbox)
- Event management (create/edit/view events)
- Registration system with capacity control
- Member tiers (regular vs VIP)
- Deployment on Render.com
- Profile management with photo upload
- Video introductions (6-part template)
- VIP features for viewing participant data
- LINE Bot integration
- Content moderation system
- Event poster generation
- Basic analytics

### âœ… Completed (Phase 3)
- Search and filtering
- Notification system
- Social sharing integration
- Mobile optimization (PWA)
- Performance optimization
- Beta testing (50 users)
- Market preparation

## Technical Architecture
- **Frontend**: React + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS
- **Backend**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Storage**: CRDT (Yjs) + NeDB + Cloudflare R2
- **Payment**: LINE Pay (primary) + ECPay (backup)
- **Deployment**: Render.com (free tier)
- **Media**: Cloudinary for images/videos

## Key Features
- Offline-first design (works in MRT tunnels)
- VIP membership system (â‚©1,000 + â‚©300/month)
- Event types: Day trips, dining events, 2-day trips
- Video self-introductions (â‚©800 creation, â‚©200 editing)
- Taiwan-localized payment options
- Luxury positioning with privacy protection

The plan shows a complete 6-month development roadmap with most milestones marked as completed, suggesting the project is ready for final testing and launch.

Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.
            
What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits" 
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered
- Don't include generic development practices
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts. 
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```
I'll analyze the codebase and create a comprehensive CLAUDE.md file for future Claude Code instances.

NODE_ENV=development
PORT=3001

# JWT Authentication
JWT_SECRET=your-super-secret-jwt-key-here
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=your-refresh-token-secret-here

# LINE Pay Configuration
LINE_PAY_CHANNEL_ID=your_line_pay_channel_id
LINE_PAY_CHANNEL_SECRET=your_line_pay_channel_secret
LINE_PAY_SANDBOX=true

# LINE Bot Configuration
LINE_BOT_CHANNEL_ACCESS_TOKEN=your_line_bot_access_token
LINE_BOT_CHANNEL_SECRET=your_line_bot_channel_secret

# ECPay Configuration (Backup Payment)
ECPAY_MERCHANT_ID=your_ecpay_merchant_id
ECPAY_HASH_KEY=your_ecpay_hash_key
ECPAY_HASH_IV=your_ecpay_hash_iv
ECPAY_SANDBOX=true

# Cloudinary Configuration
CLOUDINARY_CLOUD_NAME=your_cloudinary_cloud_name
CLOUDINARY_API_KEY=your_cloudinary_api_key
CLOUDINARY_API_SECRET=your_cloudinary_api_secret

# Cloudflare R2 Configuration
R2_ACCOUNT_ID=your_r2_account_id
R2_ACCESS_KEY_ID=your_r2_access_key_id
R2_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=your_r2_secret_access_key
R2_BUCKET_NAME=shesocial-data

# Email Configuration
EMAIL_SERVICE=gmail
EMAIL_USER=your_email@gmail.com
EMAIL_PASS=your_app_password

# Frontend URL
CLIENT_URL=http://localhost:3000

# Database Configuration
DB_PATH=./data/shesocial.db
BACKUP_PATH=./backups/

# Session Configuration
SESSION_SECRET=your-session-secret-here

# Rate Limiting
RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW_MS=900000
RATE_LIMIT_MAX_REQUESTS=100

# Render.com Configuration (Production)
# RENDER_EXTERNAL_URL=https://your-app.onrender.com

content.text:
Based on my comprehensive analysis of the SheSocial codebase, here's a detailed overview of the architecture and development workflow:

## **SheSocial Codebase Architecture Analysis**

### **1. Project Structure and Key Directories**

The project follows a monorepo structure with clear separation of frontend and backend:

```
shesocial/
â”œâ”€â”€ client/                    # React frontend (fully implemented)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ App.tsx           # Main application component
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.css         # Comprehensive luxury design system
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ main.tsx          # React entry point
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ assets/           # Static assets
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ package.json          # Frontend dependencies
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ tailwind.config.js    # Tailwind CSS luxury theme
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ vite.config.ts        # Vite build configuration
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ tsconfig.*.json       # TypeScript configurations
â”œâ”€â”€ server/                    # Backend (not yet implemented)
â”œâ”€â”€ shared/                    # Shared types and utilities (planned)
â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                      # Documentation (planned)
â”œâ”€â”€ package.json              # Root project scripts
â””â”€â”€ .env.example              # Environment configuration template
```

### **2. Package.json Files and Scripts**

**Root Package.json (`/home/yanggf/a/shesocial/package.json`):**
- **Development Scripts**: Concurrent frontend/backend development (`npm run dev`)
- **Build Scripts**: Separate client/server build processes
- **Install Scripts**: Automated dependency installation for all packages
- **Key Dependencies**: `concurrently` for running multiple processes

**Client Package.json (`/home/yanggf/a/shesocial/client/package.json`):**
- **Framework**: React 19 with React DOM
- **Build Tool**: Vite 7.0.3 with TypeScript support
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4.1.11 with PostCSS and Autoprefixer
- **Development**: ESLint 9.30.1 with TypeScript and React plugins
- **Scripts**: `dev`, `build`, `lint`, `preview`

### **3. Frontend Architecture**

**Technology Stack:**
- **React 19**: Latest React with new features and performance improvements
- **TypeScript**: Strict typing with comprehensive configuration
- **Tailwind CSS 4.x**: Advanced utility-first CSS framework
- **Vite**: Fast development server and build tool

**Design System:**
- **Luxury Color Palette**: Gold (#d4af37), champagne (#f7e7ce), pearl (#faf0e6)
- **Typography**: Inter + Noto Sans TC for international support
- **Components**: Comprehensive luxury component library with:
  - `.btn-luxury` - Gradient luxury buttons
  - `.card-luxury` - Glass morphism cards
  - `.input-luxury` - Styled form inputs
  - `.badge-luxury` - Status badges
  - `.nav-luxury` - Navigation components

**Key Features:**
- **Mobile-first responsive design** (90% Taiwan users on mobile)
- **Traditional Chinese localization** (Taiwan market focus)
- **Glass morphism effects** with backdrop blur
- **Custom animations** (fade-in, slide-up, pulse-luxury)
- **Accessibility features** (keyboard navigation, reduced motion)

### **4. Backend Architecture (Planned)**

Based on documentation, the backend will use:
- **Runtime**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Database**: CRDT (Yjs) + NeDB for lightweight storage
- **Payment Integration**: LINE Pay (primary) + ECPay (backup)
- **Media Storage**: Cloudinary for images/videos
- **File Storage**: Cloudflare R2 for persistence
- **Authentication**: JWT with refresh tokens

### **5. Configuration Files**

**TypeScript Configuration:**
- **Target**: ES2022 with DOM libraries
- **Module System**: ESNext with bundler resolution
- **Strict Mode**: Enabled with comprehensive linting
- **JSX**: React JSX transform

**Tailwind Configuration:**
- **Custom Color Palette**: Extended luxury colors
- **Typography**: Custom font families for Taiwan market
- **Animations**: Custom keyframes for luxury effects
- **Responsive Design**: Mobile-first breakpoints

**Vite Configuration:**
- **React Plugin**: @vitejs/plugin-react
- **Build Optimization**: Production-ready configuration

**ESLint Configuration:**
- **TypeScript Support**: Full TypeScript linting
- **React Hooks**: Latest React hooks rules
- **React Refresh**: Vite hot reload support

### **6. Development Workflow and Documentation**

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Install all dependencies: `npm run install:all`
2. Start development: `npm run dev`
3. Frontend: http://localhost:5173/
4. Backend: http://localhost:3001/ (when implemented)

**Build Process:**
1. Build client: `npm run build:client`
2. Build server: `npm run build:server`
3. Production start: `npm start`

**Documentation:**
- **Main README**: Comprehensive setup and architecture overview
- **Client README**: Frontend-specific documentation
- **Implementation Plan**: 6-month development roadmap
- **Specification**: Detailed business requirements (in Traditional Chinese)

### **7. Database/Storage Approach**

**Planned Architecture:**
- **CRDT (Yjs)**: Conflict-free replicated data types for offline-first functionality
- **NeDB**: Lightweight file-based database for development
- **Cloudflare R2**: Production data persistence
- **Local Storage**: Browser-based caching for PWA features

**Data Structure Examples:**
- User profiles with CRDT Maps for collaborative editing
- Event data with participant arrays
- Version control for content changes

### **8. Key Dependencies and Their Purposes**

**Frontend Dependencies:**
- **React 19**: Core framework with latest features
- **TypeScript**: Type safety and developer experience
- **Tailwind CSS 4.x**: Utility-first styling with custom luxury theme
- **Vite**: Fast development and optimized builds

**Development Dependencies:**

  "scripts": {
    "dev": "concurrently \"npm run dev:server\" \"npm run dev:client\"",
    "dev:client": "cd client && npm run dev",
    "dev:server": "cd server && npm run dev",
    "build": "npm run build:client && npm run build:server",
    "build:client": "cd client && npm run build",
    "build:server": "cd server && npm run build",
    "start": "cd server && npm start",
    "install:all": "npm install && cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "social",
    "taiwan",
    "luxury",
    "events",
    "crdt",
    "offline-first"
  ],
  "author": "SheSocial Team",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "concurrently": "^8.2.2"
  }
}

content.text: Now I'll create the CLAUDE.md file with all the essential information:

input.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

SheSocial is a luxury social activity platform for Taiwan's high-end market, focused on helping users find romantic partners. The project uses an offline-first architecture with CRDT synchronization, optimized for Taiwan's mobile-first user base.

## Development Commands

### Setup
```bash
npm run install:all          # Install all dependencies (root, client, server)
```

### Development
```bash
npm run dev                  # Run both client and server concurrently
npm run dev:client           # Run only frontend (http://localhost:5173)
npm run dev:server           # Run only backend (http://localhost:3001)
```

### Client-specific commands
```bash
cd client
npm run dev                  # Start Vite dev server
npm run build               # Build for production
npm run lint                # Run ESLint
npm run preview             # Preview production build
```

### Build & Deploy
```bash
npm run build               # Build both client and server
npm run build:client        # Build only frontend
npm run build:server        # Build only backend
npm start                   # Start production server
```

## Architecture Overview

### Monorepo Structure
- `client/` - React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS frontend
- `server/` - Node.js + Express + TypeScript backend (not yet implemented)
- `shared/` - Shared types and utilities (planned)
- Root package.json coordinates the entire project with `concurrently`

### Frontend Architecture
- **Framework**: React 19 with TypeScript and Vite
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4.x with custom luxury design system
- **State Management**: React Hooks + planned CRDT (Yjs) integration
- **Target**: Taiwan market with Traditional Chinese localization
- **Design**: Mobile-first responsive design with luxury aesthetics

### Backend Architecture (Planned)
- **Runtime**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Database**: CRDT (Yjs) + NeDB for offline-first functionality
- **Payment**: LINE Pay (primary) + ECPay (backup)
- **Storage**: Cloudflare R2 for persistence
- **Media**: Cloudinary for image/video processing

## Design System

### Color Palette
- **Primary**: Orange gradient (#f18444) for main actions
- **Secondary**: Gray scale (#f8f9fa to #202124) for text and backgrounds
- **Luxury**: Gold (#d4af37), champagne (#f7e7ce), pearl (#faf0e6), rose (#f4c2c2)

### Component Classes
- **Buttons**: `.btn-luxury`, `.btn-luxury-outline`, `.btn-luxury-ghost`
- **Cards**: `.card-luxury`, `.card-luxury-hover`
- **Forms**: `.input-luxury`
- **Layout**: `.container-luxury`, `.section-luxury`
- **Effects**: `.glass` (backdrop blur), `.text-gradient-luxury`

### Typography
- **Primary**: Inter + Noto Sans TC (for Traditional Chinese)
- **Secondary**: Noto Serif TC (for headings)
- **Monospace**: JetBrains Mono

## Key Technical Decisions

### Taiwan Market Optimization
- **Language**: Traditional Chinese primary, English secondary
- **Payment**: LINE Pay integration (70% of Taiwan users)
- **Mobile-first**: 90% of users access via mobile
- **Offline-first**: CRDT architecture for subway/tunnel usage

### Technology Stack Rationale
- **React 19**: Latest features and performance improvements
- **Tailwind CSS 4.x**: Advanced utility classes with custom design system
- **Vite**: Fast development server and optimal builds
- **CRDT**: Enables offline-first functionality with conflict resolution
- **NeDB**: Lightweight file-based database for simple deployment

## Development Environment

### Configuration Files
- `client/tsconfig.json` - TypeScript configuration for React
- `client/tailwind.config.js` - Luxury design system configuration
- `client/vite.config.ts` - Vite build configuration with React plugin
- `client/eslint.config.js` - ESLint rules for React + TypeScript

### Environment Variables
Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and configure:
- `LINE_PAY_CHANNEL_ID` - LINE Pay integration
- `CLOUDINARY_*` - Media upload configuration  
- `JWT_SECRET` - Authentication tokens

## Development Status

### Completed âœ…
- Project structure and monorepo setup
- React 19 frontend with luxury design system
- Tailwind CSS 4.x configuration with custom components
- Traditional Chinese localization
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Development environment configuration

### In Progress ğŸ”„
- Backend server implementation
- CRDT architecture validation

### Planned ğŸ“‹
- User authentication system
- LINE Pay payment integration
- Event CRUD operations
- Media upload with Cloudinary
- PWA offline functionality
- Render.com deployment

## Architecture Patterns

### Component Organization
- Single `App.tsx` currently contains all UI (to be refactored)
- Custom CSS classes in `index.css` for reusable components
- Tailwind utilities for layout and spacing

### State Management Strategy
- React Hooks for local state
- CRDT (Yjs) planned for distributed state management
- Offline-first architecture with local persistence

### Payment Integration
- LINE Pay as primary payment method (Taiwan market leader)
- ECPay as backup for credit card processing
- Payment flow designed for mobile UX

## Testing Strategy

### Current Setup
- ESLint for code quality
- TypeScript for type safety
- No testing framework configured yet

### Planned Testing
- Jest for unit tests
- Playwright for E2E payment flows
- Manual testing for UX validation

## Deployment

### Target Platform
- **Render.com** free tier for cost-effective hosting
- **Cloudflare R2** for file storage
- **Cloudinary** for media processing
- Auto-deploy from GitHub integration

### Cost Optimization
- Designed for <$100/month operational costs
- Serverless-first architecture where possible
- Efficient CRDT synchronization to minimize bandwidth

## Market Context

### Target Users
- Taiwan high-end social activity participants
- Age range: 25-45 years old
- Income: Upper-middle class and above
- Device usage: Primarily mobile (90%+)

### Business Model
- Entry fee: TWD 600-1000
- Monthly membership: TWD 300
- Event participation fees: TWD 1000-1200
- VIP features for premium members

### Competition
- Differentiation through luxury positioning
- Privacy-first approach
- Offline-first technical architecture
- Taiwan-specific payment and social integrations

- `client/` - React 19 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS frontend
- `server/` - Node.js + Express + TypeScript backend (not yet implemented)
- `shared/` - Shared types and utilities (planned)
- Root package.json coordinates the entire project with `concurrently`

### Frontend Architecture
- **Framework**: React 19 with TypeScript and Vite
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4.x with custom luxury design system
- **State Management**: React Hooks + planned CRDT (Yjs) integration
- **Target**: Taiwan market with Traditional Chinese localization
- **Design**: Mobile-first responsive design with luxury aesthetics

### Backend Architecture (Planned)
- **Runtime**: Node.js + Express + TypeScript
- **Database**: CRDT (Yjs) + NeDB for offline-first functionality
- **Payment**: LINE Pay (primary) + ECPay (backup)
- **Storage**: Cloudflare R2 for persistence
- **Media**: Cloudinary for image/video processing

## Design System

### Color Palette
- **Primary**: Orange gradient (#f18444) for main actions
- **Secondary**: Gray scale (#f8f9fa to #202124) for text and backgrounds
- **Luxury**: Gold (#d4af37), champagne (#f7e7ce), pearl (#faf0e6), rose (#f4c2c2)

### Component Classes
- **Buttons**: `.btn-luxury`, `.btn-luxury-outline`, `.btn-luxury-ghost`
- **Cards**: `.card-luxury`, `.card-luxury-hover`
- **Forms**: `.input-luxury`
- **Layout**: `.container-luxury`, `.section-luxury`
- **Effects**: `.glass` (backdrop blur), `.text-gradient-luxury`

### Typography
- **Primary**: Inter + Noto Sans TC (for Traditional Chinese)
- **Secondary**: Noto Serif TC (for headings)
- **Monospace**: JetBrains Mono

## Key Technical Decisions

### Taiwan Market Optimization
- **Language**: Traditional Chinese primary, English secondary
- **Payment**: LINE Pay integration (70% of Taiwan users)
- **Mobile-first**: 90% of users access via mobile
- **Offline-first**: CRDT architecture for subway/tunnel usage

### Technology Stack Rationale
- **React 19**: Latest features and performance improvements
- **Tailwind CSS 4.x**: Advanced utility classes with custom design system
- **Vite**: Fast development server and optimal builds
- **CRDT**: Enables offline-first functionality with conflict resolution
- **NeDB**: Lightweight file-based database for simple deployment

## Development Environment

### Configuration Files
- `client/tsconfig.json` - TypeScript configuration for React
- `client/tailwind.config.js` - Luxury design system configuration
- `client/vite.config.ts` - Vite build configuration with React plugin
- `client/eslint.config.js` - ESLint rules for React + TypeScript

### Environment Variables
Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and configure:
- `LINE_PAY_CHANNEL_ID` - LINE Pay integration
- `CLOUDINARY_*` - Media upload configuration  
- `JWT_SECRET` - Authentication tokens

## Development Status

### Completed âœ…
- Project structure and monorepo setup
- React 19 frontend with luxury design system
- Tailwind CSS 4.x configuration with custom components
- Traditional Chinese localization
- Mobile-first responsive design
- Development environment configuration

### In Progress ğŸ”„
- Backend server implementation
- CRDT architecture validation

### Planned ğŸ“‹
- User authentication system
- LINE Pay payment integration
- Event CRUD operations
- Media upload with Cloudinary
- PWA offline functionality
- Render.com deployment

## Architecture Patterns

### Component Organization
- Single `App.tsx` currently contains all UI (to be refactored)
- Custom CSS classes in `index.css` for reusable components
- Tailwind utilities for layout and spacing

### State Management Strategy
- React Hooks for local state
- CRDT (Yjs) planned for distributed state management
- Offline-first architecture with local persistence

### Payment Integration
- LINE Pay as primary payment method (Taiwan market leader)
- ECPay as backup for credit card processing
- Payment flow designed for mobile UX

## Testing Strategy

### Current Setup
- ESLint for code quality
- TypeScript for type safety
- No testing framework configured yet

### Planned Testing
- Jest for unit tests
- Playwright for E2E payment flows
- Manual testing for UX validation

## Deployment

### Target Platform
- **Render.com** free tier for cost-effective hosting
- **Cloudflare R2** for file storage
- **Cloudinary** for media processing
- Auto-deploy from GitHub integration

### Cost Optimization
- Designed for <$100/month operational costs
- Serverless-first architecture where possible
- Efficient CRDT synchronization to minimize bandwidth

## Market Context

### Target Users
- Taiwan high-end social activity participants
- Age range: 25-45 years old
- Income: Upper-middle class and above
- Device usage: Primarily mobile (90%+)

### Business Model
- Entry fee: TWD 600-1000
- Monthly membership: TWD 300
- Event participation fees: TWD 1000-1200
- VIP features for premium members

### Competition
- Differentiation through luxury positioning
- Privacy-first approach
- Offline-first technical architecture
- Taiwan-specific payment and social integrations
